definition: to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to be dispersed/to break down/to fester/to ulcerate

sentences.english: The Government withdrew with its troops to Versailles.
sentences.chinese: 政府及其軍隊潰逃到凡爾塞。

sentences.english: The enemy fled in disorder by night.
Certainly it would be better than losing the bulbs to the marauding bands of fleeing German soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 當然，吃了總比讓那些潰逃的德國兵搶去了強。

sentences.english: Many soldiers fell wounded in their flight from the defeat.
sentences.chinese: 許多士兵在潰逃中受傷。

sentences.english: Our tanks cut in ahead of the escaping aggressors.
sentences.chinese: 我們的坦克搶到前面去攔住那些潰逃的侵略者。

sentences.english: Cao Cao lost horribly and almost got killed on the way back.
sentences.chinese: 曹操倉惶戰敗，幾乎死在潰逃途中。
